topic: How to benchmark event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to benchmark event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Benchmarking Event-Driven Systems Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to benchmark an event-driven system built with FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding the importance of benchmarking event-driven systems
Setting up a basic FastAPI application
Profiling FastAPI endpoints using built-in tools and third-party libraries
Analyzing results and making optimizations for improved performance

code_examples.code:
import cProfile
import pstats
cProfile.run('main()', sort='cumulative')

version_notes: This guide is specific to Python 3.12+ as it includes the latest FastAPI features and performance improvements.
Ensure you have the latest version of FastAPI installed using pip install fastapi[all]
caveats: While this guide focuses on event-driven systems with FastAPI, the principles can be applied to other Python web frameworks and microservices.
Benchmarking is not a one-time process, it's essential to continuously profile your application for performance optimization.
